description: The function does not validate the input 'postObj' and 'i' before using them. This can lead to type coercion vulnerabilities where an attacker can pass unexpected types to manipulate the program flow. For example, if an attacker passes a string instead of a number for 'postObj.deleted', the 'parseInt' function will return NaN, which can lead to unexpected behavior. Additionally, the function does not check if 'results.userData[postObj.uid]', 'results.editors[postObj.editor]', 'results.favourites[i]', 'results.voteData.upvotes[i]', 'results.voteData.downvotes[i]', and 'results.privileges[i]' are null before using them. This can lead to null pointer dereference
